required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome Injection in Patients With Advanced HER2 Negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Single-arm, Phase II Study of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome Injection in Patients With Advanced HER2 Negative Breast Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, single-arm, phase II study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome in patients with advanced HER2 negative breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, single-arm, phase II study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome in patients with advanced HER2 negative breast cancer. Eligible patients will receive Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome 20 mg/m2 by an intravenous infusion (IV), every 21 days (q3w, 1 cycle) until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, death, or investigator or patient decision.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to the final documentation of response of the last subject(assessed up to 36 months)
primary_outcome.description: To investigate the preliminary antitumor efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to the final documentation of response of the last subject(assessed up to 36 months)
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the preliminary antitumor efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to death,lost to follow-up,withdrawal,or study end,whichever occurred first,assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the preliminary antitumor efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to death,lost to follow-up,withdrawal,or study end,whichever occurred first,assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the preliminary antitumor efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to death,lost to follow-up,withdrawal,or study end,whichever occurred first,assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the preliminary antitumor efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the administration of the first dose to 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence and severity of adverse events, abnormalities in physical exams, vital sign assessments, clinical laboratory assessments, ultrasonic cardiograms (UCGs) and electrocardiographs (ECGs).

arm_group.description: Patients with advanced HER2 negative breast cancer will receive 20 mg/m2 Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome injection every 21 days (a cycle) for about 6 cycles.

intervention.description: Mitoxantrone Hydrochloride Liposome 20 mg/m2, IV, on day 1 of each 21-day cycle (q3w).
